name: Katie Bentley
content: Katie Bentley | King's College London Skip to main contentDr Katie Bentley ReaderGroup Leader of the Cellular Adaptive Behaviour Lab at the Francis Crick InstituteResearch interestsBiomedical and life sciencesComputer scienceContact detailskatie.bentley@kcl.ac.ukkatie.bentley@crick.ac.ukBiographyDr Katie Bentley is a Reader in Computer Science in the Department of Informatics, at King’s College London. Katie's group develops agent-based simulations among other computational methods to simulate individual to collective cell behaviour during the growth of well-adapted structures in embryo development and abnormal, maladapted structures in diseases such as cancer and retinopathy. Research Interests Simulation of adaptive behaviour Computational biology Bio-inspired robotics Artificial Life Software engineering of biological models Cell and developmental biology Blood vessel formation Eye disease Vaccinia Virus Spread PublicationsResearchResearchLipids and Membranes Research Interest GroupA Lipids and Membranes Research Interest GroupThe Francis Crick InstituteKing’s is delighted to be a founding academic partner alongside UCL and Imperial College in the Francis Crick Institute, joining the multidisciplinary research expertise from all the Partners together to deliver world-leading biomedical research.PublicationsResearchResearchLipids and Membranes Research Interest GroupA Lipids and Membranes Research Interest GroupThe Francis Crick InstituteKing’s is delighted to be a founding academic partner alongside UCL and Imperial College in the Francis Crick Institute, joining the multidisciplinary research expertise from all the Partners together to deliver world-leading biomedical research.(N)7.04Bush HouseStrand campus, 30 Aldwych, London, WC2B 4BGBased inDepartment of InformaticsFaculty of Natural, Mathematical & Engineering SciencesThe Francis Crick Institute
